source.1e500a74:
food=input("What food do you want?")
cost=input("How much is that item?")
items=input("How many items are you buying?")
cost=int(cost)
items=int(items)
addition=cost+items
multi=cost*items
div=(multi//2)
print("addition total:", addition)
print("50% off:", div)
print(food,"total:")
print(multi)

#Mrs. Taylor comments:
#Concept would work for the scope of this project, but it is not carried out in enough detail. 
#No Planning document - a few comments but not a plan, Peer Feedback was completed but not fully used, Reflection completed.
#Program will not compile if a decimal is entered as the cost. For example: 2.99 which is a typical cost value. 
# Cost is typically a float since the decimal indicates cents. 
#No comments used. It should be common practice to introduce the program objective/title with a comment and comment each functional section of the program. 
#addition of cost + items has no real world application (?)
#Total = Multi - discount;  if a discount is used, it is subtracted from the full price.

source.e8940c2a:
**How did you come up with your idea?**
    I had outside help, and asked for suggestions on what to do. While improving it to the idea I had.
**What was the hardest part of this project?**
    Getting the code to work. Now it runs just how I want it to.
**What was the easiest part of this project?**
    The straightforwardness of the project itself.
**How did you utilize your peer feedback?**
    I had compared work and used them to make sure my code went smooth as butter.
**What was different between your plan and the final project?**
    I had to improv some parts to make it run in code.
**How well did you plan? Was your idea too easy? Too hard? Just right?**
    I think I planned as best as I could have for my idea. I think it worked just right.
**If you had unlimited time, what would you add to this project?**
I would make a more complex list with more options on food.
source.97eb6df1: Create a plan using the planning document on paper. You may transfer the plan into your colab notebook, if you would like.
source.3c4f4d94:
## Rubric
Requirement Description Points Earned
Planning and Reflection Planning document is complete and thoughtful. Reflection (separate paper) answers required questions, is complete and thoughtful.. 10 points 7
Compiles Code Compiles. 10 points 5
Comments Code is properly commented. 10 points 0
Difficulty/Effort You chose a project of appropriate difficulty for you, that would take the full work time. If you chose a project that was too easy, you added functionality. 10 points 5
Idea Your idea is well thought out and makes sense as one program. 10 points 7
Print Print statement is included in a meaningful way and works 10 points 10
User Input User input is included in a meaningful way and works 10 points 10
Int/Float An int or float variable is appropriately created and used 10 points 10
Math Operators At least one of +, -, *, / and at least one of //, % are included and used appropriately. 20 points 20
--- "Final" Score: 74 ---
source.5f82b449:
## Project Instructions
In this project, you will demonstrate your understanding of unit 1 concepts with a project of your choice (SFW). Your project must:
* include a print statement
* include an int or a float
* ask for and use user input
* Use at least one of the following: +, -, *, /
* Use at lesat one of the following: %, //

What you choose to create is entirely up to you.
